revised_title: Volcanic Eruption in Sunda Strait and Its Aftermath
tldr: The article describes the volcanic eruption in Sunda Strait and its devastating effects. Commander F. C. P. Vereker reports on the destruction of Thwart-way Island and the formation of new islands due to the eruption. The surrounding area is covered in greenish-yellow mud and pumice stones. The author also mentions the destruction of Lampong Bay and the Java coast, as well as a whirlwind and gale experienced during the eruption. The article includes sketches and information from the logbook of the Steam-ship "Governor-General Loudon."
